TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE she was a director of a local branch of ORG ( “ the branch ” ) . On DATE the branch was liquidated . However , according to the applicant , the local tax authorities continued referring to her as “ the director of the branch ” in their fiscal documents , obliged her to provide and sign certain documents on behalf of the branch and to provide comments on the fiscal documents related to its activities .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an administrative law complaint with the ORG challenging the lawfulness of the actions of the tax authorities . In the course of the proceedings , she also asked the court to declare that the statements made by the respondent ’s officials at the court hearings concerning her involvement in the activities of the branch after its liquidation were untruthful .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court suspended the proceedings pending the outcome of a commercial dispute concerning the lawfulness of the liquidation of the branch . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings concerning the latter matter .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the applicant requested ORG to resume the proceedings in her case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court resumed the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court discontinued the proceedings on the ground that the dispute had already been determined by the courts . On DATE the Kyiv Regional Court of Appeal quashed that decision and remitted the case for fresh consideration . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG partly allowed the applicant ’s complaint and found that the tax authorities had unlawfully required her to act as the director of the branch in the course of an audit of its activities in DATE . As regards the statements made by the respondent ’s officials at the court hearings , the court found that those statements had not been “ dissemination of information ” within the meaning of the civil legislation .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE respectively , ORG and ORG upheld the judgment of ORG .

CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings the applicant amended her complaint on CARDINAL occasions . According to the Government , she lodged a request for the adjournment of the proceedings for an unspecified period . The applicant stated that she had not sought adjournment of the proceedings .

CARDINAL . In DATE PERSON , a tax officer , instituted criminal proceedings against the applicant for tax evasion . On DATE the ORG discontinued those proceedings for lack of corpus delicti in the applicant ’s actions .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant lodged with the prosecutors a criminal complaint against M. about his allegedly unlawful actions in the course of the criminal proceedings . There has been no final decision given on the applicant ’s complaint so far .
